main event: An object appearing as a bright light was reported moving East to West over the Atlantic on September 5, 1958.
interesting points: The object was detected visually and by radar by the Pan American Clipper 207., The size and shape of the object were unknown., The object's speed was noted as too fast for confirmation., The report mentioned insufficient information for a detailed analysis., There were fluctuations during tracking but no contact was established.
witness description: sighted by crew of Pan American Clipper 207
